com.kuka.roboticsAPI.applicationModel.tasks
Interface ITaskFunctionAccessor<T extends ITaskFunction>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the task function, which should be accessed via this accessor.
public interface ITaskFunctionAccessor<T extends ITaskFunction>

Accessor to a task function.

Task function accessors are used to get an access to functions provided by different tasks running in the station. Life cycle of a task function depends on a life cycle of the providing task, therefore it is only possible to access functions of the running tasks. Task function accessor provides methods to access a certain task function, as well as to determine whether the function is currently available.

Method Summary
 boolean await(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
          Waits a given amount of time for the task function to become available.
 T get()
          Gets the reference to the task function.
 boolean isAvailable()
          Indicates whether the task function is available.
 

Method Detail

get

T get()
Gets the reference to the task function.

Warning: References to task functions should not be saved for later access, as they might not always be available. If the task does not run anymore when the reference is used, an exception will be thrown.

Returns:
The task function.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the function is not available

isAvailable

boolean isAvailable()
Indicates whether the task function is available.

Task functions are not available if the providing task is not active.

Returns:
true if the task function is available, false otherwise.

await

boolean await(long time,
              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
Waits a given amount of time for the task function to become available.

Returns as soon as the task function is available or after the given time limit has been reached.

Parameters:
time - The time limit within which the task function should become available.
unit - The unit of the time limit.
Returns:
true if the task function becomes available within the allowed amount of time and false if the waiting time elapsed before the task function becomes available.
